paragraphs.body: Each of the ship's nine guns (five on the front deck, two on the rear deck, and two on the midsection of the top deck) consists of metal funnels through which ${link_0} concentrate their flames, increasing their range and firepower. paragraphs.body: Although powerful on the water's surface, the battleships' main weakness comes from air and underwater attacks; for the latter in particular, the battleships have practically no defense, aside from any waterbenders that may be on board. Due to their slow rate of fire, their firebending-powered guns, which are more adapted toward stationary or slow-moving targets, were almost ineffective against the dozens of opposing fast-moving Equalist biplanes. That, combined with their slow speed and maneuverability, allows them to be vulnerable to rapid, en masse attacks from the enemy.
